pullRequest.body:
1. $M$ is $R$-faithfully flat iff $M$ is flat and $IM \ne M$ for all maximal ideal $I \le R$
2. prove that this is equivalent to that $M$ is flat and $M \otimes N \ne 0$ is whenever $N \ne 0$

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

### PR summary [335916c051](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17805/commits/335916c05135f98e98816ea3e9942ad137a839e5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.FaithfullyFlat`|1447|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FaithfullyFlat`
`+ iff_flat_and_ideal_smul_eq_top`
`+ iff_flat_and_lTensor_faithful`
`+ iff_flat_and_lTensor_reflects_triviality`
`+ iff_flat_and_proper_ideal`
`+ iff_flat_and_rTensor_faithful`
`+ iff_flat_and_rTensor_reflects_triviality`
`+ lTensor_nontrivial`
`+ rTensor_nontrivial`
`+ self`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I think `R` is already in scope.

Maybe you can use ` N : Type ...'`, but as you prefer.

Does this hold with `N` in an arbitrary universe? (Of course we only want the `` direction with such an `N`.)
I have added instance `Module.FaithfullyFlat.lTensor_nontrivial` that works for `N` in arbitrary universes
I think maybe `FaithfullyFlat` can be defined by extending `Module.Flat`.
I think you can add a theorem that states `FaithfullyFlat R M` implies ` (N : Type*) [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N], Nontrivial N  Nontrivial (N [R] M))`. This maybe be convenient for practice.
Maybe you can also add a theorem that states `FaithfullyFlat R M` implies ` (N : Type*) [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N], Subsingleton (N [R] M)  Subsingleton N`.

```suggestion
  submodule_ne_top :  m : Ideal R (_ : Ideal.IsMaximal m), m  ( : Submodule R M)  
```

```suggestion

```
Now this instance will be automatically generated, so this line is unnecessary.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Flat/FaithfullyFlat): definition of faithfully flat module
